intro.description:
The goal of a transaction is to create an automatic navigation in the website of a projec and to execute certain instructions. Each time Convertigo detects a screen class with extractions rules, it adds on exit the extraction results of these classes.
The bold text in this help file are available in (?).

item.title: Create a new transaction
item.description:
In the tab Projects view, right click on the file Transactions of your project then press on
>New
>Transaction
>Transaction HTML
>Next
>Finish
To add variables to the entry of your transaction, press on the propriaty "Variables" (in properties view) of your transaction then on "...". Finalyy name your variables as you think is right. From now on these variables are javascript variables and are accessible anywhere in the transaction.

item.title: Create a Handler
item.description:
During the execution of a transaction, Convertigo will execute succesively the instructions contained in the handlers based on the schema of the handlers algorithm (available in (?)).
To create a handler, right click on the transaction in the tab Projects view, press on "new" then on "Handler".
Finally select the one(s) you wish

item.title: Create a statement
item.description:
For each handler, there are several instructions (Statement) that can be executed. The list is in (?) .
To add a Statement to a handler, create an Xpath request which sends back the element or action which has to be made.
Select the handler desired in the tab Projects view and press on the icon new Statement icon.
Then choose the adapted Statement.
(You can also create a Statement by richt clicking on the handler --> new --> Statement)

item.title: Make your transactions communicatove
item.description:
In the tab Projects view click on transaction.
In the tab properties view, put the propriaty « public Method » to the value true.
Right click on the transaction and click on « Extract WSDL Type » then on « yes ».
Now the key « Ctrl » is selected in the list of all the used elements by your transaction (choose them all if you do not know which ones are used).
Repeate this for all of your transactions.

item.title: Test your transactions
item.description:
To test a transaction, right click on the desired transaction and then press on "Execute".
The result is in the tab Output Tag of the browser area
